Orrall_&_Wright:
{{Short description|American country music duo}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Orrall & Wright | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = group_or_band | origin = [[United States]] | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 1994 | label = [[Giant Records (Warner Bros. subsidiary label)|Giant]] | past_members = [[Robert Ellis Orrall]]
[[Curtis Wright]] }} '''Orrall & Wright''' was an American [[country music]] duo composed of [[Robert Ellis Orrall]] and [[Curtis Wright]]. Both members had recorded solo albums and had charted singles of their own prior to Orrall & Wright's inception. As Orrall & Wright, they charted two more singles and recorded a self-titled album on the [[Giant Records (Warner Bros. subsidiary label)|Giant]] label. Unlike most other country music duos present at the time, Orrall & Wright's members shared lead vocals on every song that they recorded.{{cite journal |last=Simons |first=David |date=July 1994 |title=New Traditions: Orrall & Wright |journal=New Country |volume=1 |issue=5 |pages=16 |issn=1074-536X}} Although active for only one year, they received a Duo of the Year nomination from the [[Country Music Association]].{{cite web |url=http://www.peermusic.com/artistpage/Robert_Ellis_Orrall.html |title=Robert Ellis Orrall |accessdate=2008-01-04 |work=Peer Music |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20071213154054/http://www.peermusic.com/artistpage/Robert_Ellis_Orrall.html |archivedate = 2007-12-13}}{{cite web |url=http://www.cmt.com/artists/news/1472579/20030612/bellamy_brothers.jhtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930023836/http://www.cmt.com/artists/news/1472579/20030612/bellamy_brothers.jhtml |url-status=dead |archive-date=September 30, 2007 |title=They Vocal Duo Dilemma: They Also Serve Those Who Also Ran |accessdate=2008-01-04 |last=Morris |first=Edward |date=2000-08-10 |work=[[Country Music Television]]}}{{cite web |url=http://cmaawards.net/2007/database/ByYear.aspx?year=1994 |title=Awards Database - 1994 |accessdate=2008-01-04 |work=[[Country Music Association]]}} By the end of 1994, both members resumed their solo careers. Wright joined the band [[Shenandoah (band)|Shenandoah]], in which he served as lead singer until being replaced with Jimmy Yeary in 2007. After leaving Shenandoah, he joined [[Pure Prairie League]]. Orrall, meanwhile, has continued a solo career. ==''Orrall & Wright'' (1994)== {{Infobox album | italic_title = no | name = ''Orrall & Wright''{{cite magazine|url=https://worldradiohistory.com/Archive-All-Music/Billboard/90s/1994/BB-1994-08-13.pdf|title=Album Reviews|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|page=60|date=August 13, 1994}} | type = studio | artist = Orrall & Wright | cover = orrall&wright.jpg | alt = | released = {{Start date|1994|7|12}} | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = [[country music|Country]] | length = 32:29 | label = Giant | producer = [[Lynn Peterzell]], Robert Ellis Orrall, Curtis Wright | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = | misc = {{Singles | name = Orrall & Wright | type = studio | single1 = She Loves Me Like She Means It | single1date = June 3, 1994 | single2 = If You Could Say What I'm Thinking | single2date = October 11, 1994 | single3 = What Do You Want from Me | single3date = 1995 }} }} ===Track listing=== #"She Loves Me Like She Means It" ([[Angelo Petraglia|Angelo]], Robert Ellis Orrall, Billy Spencer) – 2:44 #"The Last Time I Loved Like That" (Orrall, Curtis Wright) – 3:50 #"I'm Outta Here" ([[Jeff Knight (musician)|T.
